long_description:
# LightStep

Lighter alternative to `globalstep`

## Features

- Configurable step speed
- Auto Stop/Start
- Identical API (to that of `core.globalstep`)

## How it works

The configured "step speed" (`lightstep.step_speed`, float, default 1.0) is in seconds, and used directly in a `core.after`

The number of players online is tracked so the light step can be turned off when no players are on, and restarted when a player joins

This does mean that the "step speed" should never be a huge number, else some mods making use of it would react too slowly (It also means mods which want things running always shouldn't use a light step, because it will get turned off when no players are on)

## Example

This mod simply sends the player's position (x, y, z) to them in chat

```lua
-- mod.conf
name = my_mod
depends = lightstep
```

```lua
-- init.lua
lightstep.register_step(function (dtime)
    --[[ Warning:
            dtime may be huge, due to the fact the step might have been 
            turned off, so don't use this for any lag detection code
    --]]
    for _,player in ipairs(core.get_connected_players()) do
        local name = player:get_player_name()
        local pos = player:get_pos()
        core.chat_send_player(name, "Pos: " .. core.pos_to_string(pos, 0))
    end
end)
```
